name: Momosan Ramen & Sake
address: 342 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA

reviews.text: Delicious food! The ramen was perfect! Staff was very friendly. Would definitely go back!

Very good tan tan men and popcorn shrimp! Thought the staff were overly strict on seating policy even though the restaurant had space (eg needing full party, asking pairs to sit shoulder to shoulder). May just do takeaway next time.
Everything we ate was wonderful and arrived very quickly.

Incredible broth. The tonkotsu pork both was so smooth, and creamy. The unique thin shaved chasu was incredible.

Staff were really friendly, and service was excellent.
Delicious! Had the lunch set Tan Tan Ramen + Spicy Tuna Roll + Gyoza. Value for money. Great ambience and service. Walk-in alone. Sat at the bar. Table for one.

Good ramen, duck taco appetizers were a bit greasy and wasn't a fan of the deep fried taco shells.
The service was disappointing. We had to flag down a waiter after first sitting down for a while to get water and our order taken. After finishing our main course, we were rushed multiple times to pay our bill and was then directly asked to give up our seats because there was another party waiting, even when there were other tables open. Unless you tell us in the beginning about a time limit on the table, it's outrageous to rush or ask customers to leave.

New favorite ramen spot!
Ambiance (5/5): Sleek dining room with high top seating facing the windows or bar seating, or regular low seated tables. The establishment was only a third full on a random weeknight at 6:30p so it was very quiet and peaceful.
Service (5/5): Our server was manning the bar and also attending to a few tables. Since we sat at the bar, we were serviced quickly and often! She was very friendly and checked in with us at the perfect cadence. She even suggested using their special hot sauce when we were eating and it definitely elevated the meal.
Thereâ€™s a dinner special of 1 ramen and 1 app for $30 (some of the options were extra $) so it only makes sense for some of the combination orders.
Pork Bao Buns (5/5): WOW, the pieces of pork were generous, thick but also super super tender. The sauce was creamy and the bun was soft/fresh. It has to be one of the best pork buns that Iâ€™ve had!
Tan Tan Ramen (5/5): Holy smokes, this is one of the best ramen Iâ€™ve had in the city!! The ramen noodles were a perfect chew and bounce which soaked up the rich sesame broth. The broth is so savory and packed with tons of flavors at once. Half soft boiled egg.
Spicy Tonkatsu (5/5): I liked my tan tan more but this ramen was equally good. Half soft boiled egg.
Second visit: The waitress remembered me!!
Tsukemen Ramen (4/5): This was a bit of a letdown compared to my first visit because: the soup was not hot enough and the thin slice of meat in the bowl was less impressive. The noodles were superb (cold as supposed to be). There's chunks of meat in the broth that were tender! Half soft boiled egg.
Service was great and the people pleasant. Nothing fantastical but very very good
Rudest staff ever. Will never be back. Hope they go out of business. The host with white hair should fired. Sheâ€™s a disgusting person.
Food was so good and the prices are very reasonable. They also give you a very generous pour on the sake

Food is nice, service is quick, but I was unknowingly served alcohol I didnâ€™t order, when I am both Muslim and taking medicine which makes consuming alcohol a severe health risk. I was then charged for the drink.

My family visited NYC and wanted to try some of the restaurants associated with chefs on Food Network. We found this place and were excited to try food from Morimoto as we have seen him on Iron Chef. The tonkotsu ramen was delicious, but karaage had some parts that were too hard to bite through. The spicy tuna roll was excellent, the tuna itself was very fresh and high quality, and the roll did not have too thick of a layer of rice. We came with our 1 and 3 year old, and the staff was kind and accommodating, but they had no high chairs and the booster seats offered had no straps. If you come with a wiggly baby or toddler, expect to hold them with your arms.

The Ramen Restaurant of Morimoto Masaharu of Iron Chef Fame. Great food and service.  Easy to see right off of Lexington Avenue in Manhattan.   Parking on the street is available but it fills up fast especially on the weekends and at night.  Parking lot near by.   Long lines but it moves quickly.   Will definitely be going back.   Ramen portion is a little small.  But very delicious.  I recommend the Tsukemen Ramen and they Sticky Ribs are a must..
I had lunch here and it was very delicious. I had the tonkatsu ramen with spicy tuna maki, pork belly bao and soft shell crab boa. One of the Best ramen spots per my cousin.
O Ramen estava perfeito. Absurdamente perfeito. O garÃ§om nos deu detalhes e tirou dÃºvidas sobre o cardÃ¡pio. Veio tudo muito rÃ¡pido.
Incredible all around! Superior food and service. Got the soft shell crab sushi roll, gyoza, Karaage chicken and tonkotsu and couldnâ€™t of been more happy :)

Original Japanese Iron Shef Morimotos restaurant. Prices and food can't be beat. Amazing food and drinks. Tables can be shared with other parties depending on how busy but it's always a good thing for my visits. A must visit IMHO.

I donâ€™t give 10s often but WOW

no wait on weekday, quick service and generous portion + solid $30 ramen w app deal

the spicy tonkotsu ramen had such deep flavor and spice as well as the most juicy pork portion and karage chicken was made with love. definitely coming back !

Really average ramen, had the tonkotsu and it was pretty tasteless. I've had instant ramen with more taste than that.

The only good part was the Karaage which had flavor.

I am brought up with ramen being fast food so it feels a bit crazy to be paying almost $100 (incl tips) for a starter, the ramen, and a beer each for two people, but it's NYC, it is tasty, and conveniently close to my accommodation. The ribs might be my favourite.
I would consider this a treat.
Thanks to the customers
My go to spot for ramen! Great service and staff

So delighted by this incredible meal. The Dinner set, Tokyo chicken ramen with Spicy Tuna Sushi is so delicious. Very savory and well cooked. The service is top notch and the employees were very accommodating. 10/10
Itâ€™s a good place to grab lunch or appetizers. Tasty food & good value.

I have been here 3x for lunch
Love the food and service
They are also really quick
Best ramen and maki in grand central
Amazing service, amazing food amazing everything! A must check-out ! Ramen is top tier

Wow!! Best spicy tuna roll Iâ€™ve ever had, such natural and balanced spice, the tuna was so fresh and delicious. My husband got a poke bowl and raved about it, he can be pretty picky and he was filled up and we both felt great all afternoon thanks to our meals. We were in a rush so we took our food to go, it was ready right on time and the staff was attentive as soon as we stepped in the door, so kind, and had our order right there ready. I wish we had time to sit, and Iâ€™ll definitely be taking the time to really dig into the menu next time Iâ€™m in town. What a gem! :)
Casual ramen and sake spot near grand central.
Top service! Awesome food! ğŸ‘Œ
Nice place

My order was relatively small and simple.
Seaweed salad and sushi.
The waiting time was 40 min!!!
The longest service Iâ€™ve ever had and the cafe was not that busy.
I have to admit, the quality of food is good - thank you to the chef!
However the service was extremely slow. I am under impression that they simply forgot about my order.
Wonderful food experience and very kind. Thanks ğŸ˜Š
Great food and service. The spicy vegan ramen was excellent!
Joe at the bar made great recommendations and very friendly
Great service from Jenny! Thank you! Foods still the best, perfectly the same quality and even better than 8 years ago!
Nice place, very professional staff.Ramen  soup got a lot of flavor.try black garlic pepper in the soup it's delicious!.
Sticky ribs were the best ribs Iâ€™ve ever had.
The food is fantastic. Susan the hostess is meh
The all star ramen was tuff
Tan tan was so good

The coziness of the place was very comforting and the service was beyond excellent. not too overbearing but came in right when you needed too. our server shane gave us very good and detailed information about the food and was quick/very friendly.  the sticky ribs appetizer are to DIE for and i think it would be impossible to describe the taste fully but they had a sweet and perfectly crisp outside with an extremely tender and savory meat inside. Next was the Spicy tonkotsu and it was excellent. creamy broth and buttery rich noodles made it so delicious. the egg and pork were cooked to perfection. and the sides like mushrooms and such were also paired nicely with the ramen. ten out of ten experience and i would definitely come here again. this place BLOWS all other ramen shops out of the water. definitely recommend eating here.

Momosan has great food and excellent service. Took my wife for a belated V-Day meal. We had a couple apps, spicy tonkotsu ramen, and a spicy tuna roll. Also a glass of rose wine. Everything was so tasty and the vibe was very chill. We really enjoyed it.
Great place for a consistent meal !
Lovely experience with cute indoor setting and attentive staff. Tonkatsu and soft shell bao dinner combo was especially delicious.
My fave Ramen place in NYC! Portions are generous so come hungry!
Great meal and Joseph really looked after us. Attentive service with a small but delightful menu. Sushi was the best!
Great experience
I really wanted to like it.. great service and the restaurant has a good ambiance.. but the ramen had nothing to it.. just very meh..

Fantastic food, fantastic service. The ramen is easily some of the best Iâ€™ve ever had, and the people were so kind and accommodating. 10/10 I will be back.

We come here every time we're in NY. Excellent service, excellent food! We were a party of 4 and chose a variety of appetizers and main dishes. Everything was so good! My husband loved his beer and I loved my mango martini.

Amazing expierience! The food is delicious and the team is super kind! I went 2 days in a row, both times I sat on the counter and was served by Johan! Great guy! If you are in NY, you should give it a try

Fantastic ramen shop. Great service. We were greeted and well taken care of throughout the meal. The ramen was tasty and flavoursome, though a slight too salty for my London tongue. Margarita drinks have a nice balance of sweet and sour. Will return next time I'm in the area.

I come here for lunch often and always get the combo. It never disappoints - always delicious and flavorful!  One of my favorite places in the area. Would come here more often if it were more affordable for lunch - you pay for quality!

Recommended.

I got there towards the end of service, but Johan took care of me to get me seated and ordered quickly. The food was exceptional, the spicy chicken dumplings were delicious and the vegan miso ramen with sticky sweet tofu was like a hug in a bowl. Definitely recommend.

I had a great experience at this ramen spot. From the moment I walked in, I was greeted warmly by Johan, who provided excellent service throughout my visit. He recommended a seasonal cocktail called The Last Petal, a refreshing sake-based drink that was a perfect start to the meal.

For lunch, I ordered the Spicy Kakuni Tonkotsu from the menu, and it didnâ€™t disappoint. The broth was rich and flavorful, with just the right amount of heat, and the braised pork was tender and satisfying. Definitely a bowl of ramen Iâ€™d recommend.

Overall, great service and solid foodâ€”Iâ€™ll be back.

One of the best Ramen place in NYC. I ordered lunch special and everything was good!

Location: It is located along Lexington Ave. the interior is nice, typical Japanese concept. Lot of seating. The bar seating is nice because you can see how they make the sushi.

Service: not that much interaction. I was seated at the bar so I get a chance to look at the sushi master.

Food: Lunch special includes 1 ramen and 1 appetizer. I ordered extra kakuni bao for $4.

TONKATSU RAMEN: the broth was very flavorful. The meat was tender and the noodles was cooked properly. I emptied my bowl because it was so delicious.

SALMON AVOCADO ROLL: made fresh in front of me. The rice on the roll was good. And the ginger on the side was the best!

KAKUNI BAO: the meat was very soft, you dont have to chew it. The flavor has perfect seasoning. The bao was soft and new.

Price rating: 8/10 price range. $23 for tonkatsu and salmon avocado roll plus $4 for one piece of kakuni bao

I will definitely come back here because everything was good! I wanna try other food that is on the menu.
Delicious sushi rolls, edamame and seaweed salad. Spicy ramen was really spicy; chashu bop was served in a stone bowl! Johan was wonderful in serving. Would totally recommend.

I had the pleasure of dining at Momosan Ramen & Sake today, and it was an absolute delight! From the moment I stepped in, the warm and inviting ambiance set the tone for a fantastic meal.

I ordered the box set, which was a delightful combination of flavors and textures. Each item was thoughtfully prepared, showcasing fresh ingredients and impeccable presentation. The flavors were well-balanced, making every bite a delicious experience.

What truly stood out was the amazing service, especially from Johan. His attentiveness, friendly demeanor, and knowledge about the menu enhanced our dining experience immensely. Itâ€™s rare to encounter such genuine hospitality.

Overall, Iâ€™d give Momosan Ramen & Sake a solid 10/10. Whether youâ€™re a ramen enthusiast or just looking for a great place to enjoy a meal with friends, this spot is a must-visit. Highly recommended!

The ramen and apps were so good, I had to come back two nights in a row to try more dinner sets! Excellent customer service as well - Johan and other staff were super friendly and attentive. Highly recommend!!

Momosan never disappoints me. Spicy Tonkotsu paired with Curry Rice is my go-to for their lunch special. The Spicy Tonkotsu has the right amount of heat and the broth is perfectly cooked. Paired it with their generous portion of Curry Rice and that is indeed value for money. Plus there is no other Chicken Kara-age that can be comparable to Momosanâ€™s. My list of fav dishes at Momosan is endless: brussel sprouts, kakuni bun, gyoza and more. Will def return with friends and family.
One of my favorite ramen places in the whole city! Always get the tonkotsu and the apps are all great. Edamame, karage, you name it. Oh and the sake! Canâ€™t go wrong!! Thank you momosan!

I very much enjoyed the Lunch Set, a two course prefix that they also offer at dinner. I had the Tonkatsu Ramen. The broth was some of the best Iâ€™ve ever had, rich and creamy  and the noodles were perfectly cooked. It was followed by Curry Don, a simple dish of melt in your mouth pork, and curry sauce over rice. A very satisfying meal. The service couldnâ€™t have been better. The room was understated and lovely.

The service , ambiance was excellent to my surprise. Hats off to waitress Jenny for her outstanding professionalism and kindness and always with a smile. Ask for her she will make your day. The food was great and the noodles, dumplings were very tasty to my surprise as well as the shrimp spring rolls.

Of all the Ramen place - Momosan is one of my best pick - the quality of food is perfect for my palate plus Lunch Meal Set is super affordable.  Today I tried Tan Tan Ramen + California meal set. So goodğŸ˜ŠğŸ¤¤ğŸ˜‹

Favorite lunch spot! Friendliest people and
great food - Poke Don and Spicy vegan miso ramen are my go toâ€™s.

Cocktail â€œLast petalâ€ by Johan is really good!

One of the best ramen Iâ€™ve ever had. Service was excellent, was able to grab a seat at 7 on a Friday and thoroughly enjoyed our dinner and drinks. The soft shell bao and all star ramen were definitely our favorites.

Came here for the first time for dinner the other day and loved it! Had to wait about 25 minutes which wasn't too bad and upon being seated it was very clear this was a family-friendly place. The one thing I noticed is that the music was a teensy bit loud but other than that the place felt cozy and roomy! We split a few apps - the chicken karaage, the brussel sprouts, and the pork gyoza which were all delicious! The ramen was also great - I went with the chicken katsu curry special which was perfect though I will say the base was a little oily for my liking. The chicken cutlets were well-seasoned and well-breaded! All in all, a great meal with friends.

If youâ€™re ever in the area, Momosan, offers the best ramen in Midtown.  The lunch and dinner sets are of great value!  Plus if you sit at the bar, Johan, provides the most excellent service.  Oh those yummy ribs are superb!  Jenny is awesome too, if youâ€™re dining at night.  Sheâ€™s the friendly face whoâ€™s great at her job.  Both Johan and Jenny are the best!

Been to many places and this is by far our favorite! Staff is incredibly friendly, shoutout to Johan for making our experience extra pleasurable! Great atmosphere, very clean, flexible seating options. My go to is their Kakuni Bao and Tonkotsu Ramen! 10/10 would recommend (+ a short walk from grand central!)

Poke don with tuna, avocado, seaweed salad, scallion and radish over the rice was slightly spicy and rich of taste. Tan-tan Ramen was too sweet, not a favourite one. I liked dancing music and atmosphere there ğŸ’ƒ
